course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Organic Chemistry Laboratory
course.description: This is the laboratory course designed for students who enrolled in CHEM 2110 and CHEM 2111. Students will perform a series of organic experiments related to the theory learnt in courses. Students will be trained to perform a wide range of basic organic laboratory techniques, operate chemical instruments in laboratory, relate the physical and chemical principles and theory in practice and develop their data interpretation and analyzing skills. Experiments of topics such as esterification and Williamson ether synthesis will be included. For students in the programs under the four-year degree that designate the course as a required course/specified elective.
course.prerequisites: (CHEM 1010 OR CHEM 1020) AND CHEM 1050
course.corequisites: CHEM 2110 OR CHEM 2111

reviews.author: fumeancat
reviews.comment_content:
Expt. 1 Recrystallization of Organic Solids
Expt. 2 Thin Layer Chromatography
Expt. 3 Distillation of Organic Liquids
Expt. 4 Separation of Organic Components in a Mixture
Expt. 5 Williamson Ether Synthesis
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dennis is nice and patient. He explains everything well and he is willing to answer questions if you don't understand the topics.
Since it is an online lab course, there are only enquiry sessions, but I don't attend all cuz not count attendance
reviews.comment_workload:
moderate workload.
(5 quizzes + 5 lab reports + 1 oral test)
quizzes: sometimes need to watch the video for more than 2 hours  to prepare quizzes

lab report: may refer to chem2110 course materials

oral test: test your calculation skill and observation skill

reviews.author: gazelle
reviews.title: Bad grade but passionate and knowledgeable professor.
reviews.comment_content:
Expt. 1  Recrystallization of Organic Compounds
Expt. 2  Thin Layer Chromatography (TLC) of Organic Compounds
Expt. 3  Distillation & Sublimation of Organic Compounds
Expt. 4  Separation of Organic Components from a Mixture
Expt. 5  Organic Synthesis by Grignard Reaction
Expt. 6  Organic Synthesis by Nucleophilic Substitution
reviews.comment_teaching: There is a detailed lab briefing every time before the lab work begins. It seems that Dennis is passionate in teaching and knowledgeable that he would tell us everything he knows about the experiment to assist us with the lab work. Though, to me it is as boring as hell to listen to chunks of reaction mechanisms and theoretical stuff that are not very meaningful. I can't resist but fall into sleep especially my lab session is right after Lang lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Trash!!!!

My total course score is >75% (though <80%), with lab work >90%. Still, I receive a C+!!!! Not even a B-!!!! In inorg lab, comparatively, ~73% is already enough for a B-!!!! So, please bare in mind that lab courses with Dennis being the instructor is likely to be 爛 grade in nature.
reviews.comment_workload:
Remember to pre-lab every time before you come because the experimental steps are often complicated. If you failed to do so, in all likelihood you would be confused with the complicated steps and ended up leaving the lab late. 隨緣 for those long questions in lab reports. You are not going to get full score anyway, not matter how hard you try and how much you write.

For the final exam, remember to recite all the materials cover in the lecture videos. If possible, read through the recommended reference books as well. In theory these preparations take you ~2 days to do so.

reviews.author: Curryisthebest
reviews.comment_content:
Expt. 1 Recrystallization of Organic Compounds
Expt. 2 Thin Layer Chromatography (TLC) of Organic Compounds
Expt. 3  Distillation & Sublimation of Organic Compounds
Expt. 4 Separation of Organic Components from a Mixture
Expt. 5 Organic Synthesis by Grignard Reaction
Expt. 6   Organic Synthesis by Nucleophilic Substitution
reviews.comment_teaching: Each lab has a briefing session which will tell you what you need to do in experiment and explain some of the procedures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of Lab Performance is somehow so strict. But it is fair, you have to do the experiment carefully
40% Final
30% Lab Performance
30% Lab Report
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much work to do
Just a few short question have to answer at the end of the lab report,  is easy job

reviews.comment_teaching:
The briefing is very detailed.
Dr. Chan is nice to answer your questions and let you know more if you want.
Briefing video (or say recording+slide) will be provided at the end of the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of Lab Performance is somehow strict. It is hard to get full marks.
